meanings.definition: Make (someone) capable of a particular action or state.
meanings.sent1: After the training session, she felt capacitated to lead the team effectively.
meanings.sent2: The special equipment capacitated him to lift heavy objects with ease.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape capacitated him to fly through the sky effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: The new software update capacitated the computer to process data faster than before.
meanings.sent5: The magic potion capacitated the wizard to cast powerful spells beyond imagination.

meanings.definition: Having the ability or power to do something.
meanings.sent1: The skilled engineer was fully capacitated to solve complex problems in no time.
meanings.sent2: She felt more capacitated after completing the advanced training course.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape made him look even more capacitated to save the city from villains.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's determination capacitated him to break the world record effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The king's wise decisions capacitated the kingdom to prosper and thrive under his rule.
